N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6180.3 - Applicability

State Regulations
(a) The mandatory
surcharge must be levied in all cities on convictions for, findings of
liability on, or guilty pleas to, parking violations under the Vehicle and

Traffic Law and local parking laws or regulations adopted pursuant to the

Vehicle and Traffic Law. This mandatory surcharge is in addition to any fine(s)
or accrued penalties that may be imposed. Payment of the notice of violation
shall be considered satisfied when the fine, any accrued penalties and the
mandatory surcharge are paid in full. (b) The mandatory surcharge is to be paid to
the clerk of the court or bureau which made the determination of liability or
accepted the guilty plea. Within the first 10 days of the month following
collection of the surcharge, the court or bureau shall pay the surcharge
amounts collected to the justice court fund held by the New York State

Comptroller in accordance with procedures specified by the Comptroller. These
funds will then be deposited to the credit of the criminal justice improvement
account. The court or bureau shall include a report, in the form and detail
prescribed by the Comptroller, with the payment of such surcharges. Notes
